content.statement: vascular:complications:comp-003-intermediate-failure is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Complications that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

clinical_features.pathology: Neointimal (myointimal) hyperplasia at anastomoses, valves, clamp sites
surveillance: Duplex at 6 weeks, 3 months, then every 6-12 months

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

clinical_pearls: Neointimal hyperplasia peaks at 3-18 months post-surgery
Distal anastomosis is most common site of stenosis
Duplex surveillance detects stenosis before thrombosis occurs
